Students at EHMS are taking advantage of the nice weather today in various ways.

The Empowered Classroom spent the day planting and cleaning up the community gardens while the 6th graders enjoyed their first official "Open Air" (recess) today.

The "Open Air" initiative was brought to school administration by a group of 6th graders. The group prepared a presentation, expectations to be followed and even a vote by the entire class.

So, from now until the end of the school year, 6th graders have the option to spend 1/2 of their lunch period outside. Today, students played spud, frisbee, danced and soaked it all in! Way to advocate for your class, 6th graders!

#FairhavenPS
#EHMS

Looming Experience Update: The loomers have donated a grand total of 1,354 hand-loomed items this school year alone. Most recently (this morning), the group donated 125 infant hats to St. Luke's Hospital, and just last week they donated 101 hats to Peru to accompany the Art Department's Memory Project portraits.

We couldn't be more proud of what our students are achieving and the amount of lives they're impacting. Their service is very much appreciated and celebrated.

Donations:
St. Luke's Hospital = 446 hats
Shephard's Panrty = 319 hats
American Heart Association = 322 hats
Homeless Advocates of New Bedford = 50 hats
Puerto Rico = 106 hats
Fairhaven Cancer Center = 10 lap blankets hats
Peru = 101 hats
